text.div:
Level Concept Code Print Name Definition
0-S normal normal The 'typical' state. Excludes "nullified" which represents the termination state of a Role instance that was created in error.
1-L . active active The state representing the fact that the Entity is currently active in the Role.
1-L . cancelled cancelled The terminal state resulting from cancellation of the role prior to activation.
1-L . pending pending The state representing that fact that the role has not yet become active.
1-L . suspended suspended The state that represents a suspension of the Entity playing the Role. This state is arrived at from the "active" state.
1-L . terminated terminated The state representing the successful termination of the Role.
0-L nullified nullified The state representing the termination of a Role instance that was created in error.

name: v3.RoleStatus
title: v3 Code System RoleStatus
description: Codes representing the defined possible states of an Role, as defined by the Role class state machine.

concept.definition: The typical state. Excludes nullified which represents the termination state of a Role instance that was created in error.
The state representing the fact that the Entity is currently active in the Role.
The terminal state resulting from cancellation of the role prior to activation.
The state representing that fact that the role has not yet become active.
The state that represents a suspension of the Entity playing the Role. This state is arrived at from the active state.
The state representing the successful termination of the Role.
The state representing the termination of a Role instance that was created in error.
